oai_dc:dc.dc:description: <jats:p>We present new records of the invasive hammerhead flatworms <jats:italic>Bipalium kewense</jats:italic> Moseley, 1878 and <jats:italic>Bipalium vagum</jats:italic> Jones & Sterrer, 2005 (Platyhelminthes, Geoplanidae, Bipaliinae) from several states in Mexico based on iNaturalist and two vouchered specimens. This represents for Mexico the first review of distribution records of this group and highlights the importance of citizen science in monitoring the distribution of these ecologically important invasive predators. Methods for the collection and preservation of hammerhead flatworms, as well as an identification key, are proposed.</jats:p>
